awd_titl_txt: Travel: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2022 IEEE Cloud Summit
awd_abstract_narration:
The project supports travel to the 2022 Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) Cloud Summit at George Mason University Campus, Fairfax, Virginia, October 21-22, 2022. The IEEE Cloud Summit provides a unique international forum for researchers, developers, and practitioners to present cutting-edge research and best practices and to exchange ideas and views on the current trends and technical challenges related to Cloud Computing, Fog Computing, Internet of Things, and Edge Computing as well as their applications for societal benefit. The unique aspect of the IEEE Cloud Summit is that it will provide participants with a venue to share ideas and learn from academic and industry leaders. The conference's unique aspects, industrial tutorials, and hands-on experience will significantly benefit the participants.

The knowledge shared and advanced at these conferences has practical and meaningful application to many tools used in research, as well as to the ethical, cultural, and social ramifications of cloud computing technology. This grant allows the participation of students who would otherwise be unable to attend the conference and extends the impact of research presented to a broad audience of young researchers from across the country. IEEE is an open access organization, and all research and results presented and published at these events are freely available to the public.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
The primary objective of this support was to empower our students by providing them with the opportunity to attend the prestigious IEEE Cloud Summit. This world-class conference served as a unique platform for students to showcase their groundbreaking research, engage in stimulating discussions with fellow researchers, and network with industry leaders. By attending the IEEE Cloud Summit, our students gained invaluable exposure to the latest advancements in cloud computing, fostered collaborations with experts from around the globe, and enhanced their professional development. This enriching experience broadened their knowledge base and inspired them to pursue innovative research, ultimately contributing to the future of cloud computing.

A total of fifteen students were support out of which 6 were female, 1 from underrepresented minority background and 2 from predomently undergraduate institutions. 

The conference series offered a unique platform for students to connect with  individuals from a diverse sets of backgrounds, discuss their research, and receive valuable feedback from experienced professionals. These interactions not only enriched their academic experience but also broadened their understanding of the practical applications of cloud computing. By immersing themselves in the latest research and industry trends, students were inspired to push the boundaries of knowledge and contribute to the advancement of the field.


Last Modified: 12/03/2024
Modified by: Samee U Khan
